etymology.description: 四 + 季 + 豆 = a bean available in all four seasons.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “four-season bean,” highlighting year-round availability. In Mainland Chinese it usually means green/snap beans; in Taiwan it often refers to yardlong beans.

parts.english: season; quarter (of a year); time of year; harvest season

examples.chinese: 我妈妈常用四季豆炒肉(我媽媽常用四季豆炒肉)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ māma cháng yòng sìjìdòu chǎo ròu.
examples.english: My mom often stir-fries green beans with pork.

examples.chinese: 市场上四季豆一年四季都能买到(市場上四季豆一年四季都能買到)。
examples.pinyin: Shìchǎng shang sìjìdòu yīnián sìjì dōu néng mǎi dào.
examples.english: At the market, green beans are available all year round.

examples.chinese: 这道干煸四季豆很下饭(這道乾煸四季豆很下飯)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè dào gānbiān sìjìdòu hěn xiàfàn.
examples.english: This dry-fried green bean dish goes great with rice.
